Current Job Openings at OFA

1. Building and Grounds Repair & Maintenance

This position is responsible for all of the building and general grounds maintenance. This job requires a willingness to perform a variety of routine manual tasks.

Good knowledge of general building maintenance and equipment. Must be able to complete forms with accuracy; ability to understand and follow simple oral and written instructions; dependable; ability to work independently; courteous. Be in good physical condition and able to lift up to 75 pounds and knowledge of proper lifting techniques. A valid New York State driver’s license required.

Part-time position M-F; 15-20 hrs/wk; paid holidays; $12,090 year.

Call Office for the Aging – 697-5700. EOE

A New Way of Staying in Touch

On April 8th, the Madison County Office for the Aging is launching a new communication service that will come in the form of phone calls, texts, or emails. You can pick the best way you prefer to receive the communication. You will also have the option to opt out of this communication.

If you have questions or would like to sign up please call the office at 315-697-5700

2024 Farmers Market Coupon Distribution Dates & Locations

Farmers Market Coupons are available at our office located at 138 Dominic Bruno Blvd, Canastota between the hours of 8:30 am to 3:30 pm.

Eligibility Criteria:

• 60 yrs. of age or older AND

• Monthly income is at or below 185% of Federal Poverty Guidelines ($2,322/month for a one-person household, $3,152/month for a two-person household) AND have not received SFMNP coupons from any other location this year.

Each older adult in a household is eligible to receive a booklet if they meet age and income requirements. Only one booklet per person per year. Each person must be present to receive their booklet.

QUESTIONS? CALL the OFFICE FOR THE AGING 315-697-5700

The Empowered Caregiver Series presented by the Alzheimer's Association

Education programs presented by the Alzheimer's Association in partnership with Madison County Office for the Aging

Caring for someone living with dementia brings a unique set of challenges and rewards. Learn to navigate the responsibilities of middle to late-stage caregiving in this education program.

The Empowered Caregiver Series

July 29- Building Foundations of Caregiving

August 5- Supporting Independence

August 12- Communicating Effectively

August 19- Responding to Dementia-Related Behaviors

August 26- Exploring Care & Support Services

All programs are held at Madison County Office for the Aging: 138 Dominic Bruno Blvd Canastota NY 13032

Programs are held from 1:30 - 3:00 pm on each day.

Registration is not required but preferred. You can register by calling the Alzheimer's Association at 1-800-272-3900

or call the Office for the Aging at 315-697-5700 ext 215

Older New Yorker 2025 Nominations

Do you know a Madison County resident 60 or older who positively affects the community?

The Office for the Aging is seeking nominations for the county’s representative for the 2025 New York State Office for the Aging’s Older New Yorker celebration.

MCOFA is seeking nominations for someone who has performed admirable community service and civic achievement and who deserves recognition.

A completed nomination form along with a detailed summary of the accomplishments which highlights why the nominee deserves to receive recognition, should be submitted by Friday, December 6.

Applications must include contact information for both the nominee and the person nominating. The decision on who will be chosen will be based on the descriptions provided of the nominee’s accomplishments and why the person deserves recognition.

Voting takes place by the members of the MCOFA Advisory using the summaries provided.

For more information or to obtain a nomination form, contact MCOFA at 315-697-5700.

A blank nomination form is also available below that is fillable, The completed form can be emailed to information@ofamadco.org
